title: Satanpur, Dih, Raebareli
text:
Satanpur is a village in <a href="Dih%2C%20Raebareli">Dih</a> block of <a href="Rae%20Bareli%20district">Rae Bareli district</a>, <a href="Uttar%20Pradesh">Uttar Pradesh</a>, <a href="India">India</a>. It is located 25 km from <a href="Raebareli">Raebareli</a>, the district headquarters. As of 2011, it has a population of 241 people, in 41 households. It has no schools and no healthcare facilities, and it does not host a permanent market or a weekly <a href="haat">haat</a>. It belongs to the <a href="nyaya%20panchayat">nyaya panchayat</a> of <a href="Khetaudhan">Khetaudhan</a>.
The <a href="1951%20Census%20of%20India">1951 census</a> recorded Satanpur as comprising 1 hamlet, with a total population of 109 people (58 male and 51 female), in 20 households and 20 physical houses. The area of the village was given as 114 <a href="acre">acre</a>s. 2 residents were literate, both male. The village was listed as belonging to the <a href="pargana">pargana</a> of <a href="Rokha">Rokha</a> and the <a href="thana">thana</a> of <a href="Nasirabad%2C%20Raebareli">Nasirabad</a>.
The <a href="1961%20Census%20of%20India">1961 census</a> recorded Satanpur as comprising 1 hamlet, with a total population of 100 people (51 male and 49 female), in 18 households and 18 physical houses. The area of the village was given as 114 acres.
The <a href="1981%20Census%20of%20India">1981 census</a> recorded Satanpur as having a population of 134 people, in 31 households, and having an area of 46.14 <a href="hectare">hectare</a>s. The main staple foods were listed as wheat and rice.
The <a href="1991%20Census%20of%20India">1991 census</a> recorded Satanpur as having a total population of 160 people (76 male and 84 female), in 28 households and 28 physical houses. The area of the village was listed as 42 hectares. Members of the 0-6 age group numbered 34, or 21% of the total; this group was 44% male (15) and 56% female (19). Members of <a href="scheduled%20castes">scheduled castes</a> made up 56% of the village's population, while no members of <a href="scheduled%20tribes">scheduled tribes</a> were recorded. The <a href="literacy%20rate">literacy rate</a> of the village was 24% (32 men and 7 women). 42 people were classified as main workers (40 men and 2 women), while 21 people were classified as marginal workers (all women); the remaining 97 residents were non-workers. The breakdown of main workers by employment category was as follows: 40 cultivators (i.e. people who owned or leased their own land); 2 agricultural labourers (i.e. people who worked someone else's land in return for payment); 0 workers in livestock, forestry, fishing, hunting, plantations, orchards, etc.; 0 in mining and quarrying; 0 household industry workers; 0 workers employed in other <a href="manufacturing">manufacturing</a>, processing, service, and repair roles; 0 <a href="construction%20worker">construction worker</a>s; 0 employed in trade and commerce; 0 employed in transport, storage, and communications; and 0 in other services.
